edu.purdue.dtf

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.purdue.dtf.Board

  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    Board provides the basic game grid and is responsible for all the core game logic. It receives input from either human or AI based agents, and then notifies all views and other listeners with something happens for which they may need to update.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Board(int width, int height)
      Constructs a board with the specified width and height, in terms or the number of squares the board is composed of.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Board

        public Board(int width,
     int height)
        Constructs a board with the specified width and height, in terms or the number of squares the board is composed of. The standard game board for Destroy the Flags is 11 x 9.
        Parameters:
        width - The width of the game board in squares.
        height - The height of the game board in squares.

    • Method Detail

      • setFromStream

        public void setFromStream(java.io.InputStream in)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Initializes the board from a text file input stream.
        Parameters:
        in - The input stream with the file in the standard format.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - For any errors during reading the stream.

      • getPiece

        public java.lang.String getPiece(Position p)
        Returns the piece at position p.
        Parameters:
        p - The position of the square at which the piece is sought.
        Returns:
        The character code of the piece at this position.

      • isGameOver

        public boolean isGameOver()
        Returns whether the game is over or not.
        Returns:
        True if the game over condition is satisfied on the game board, false otherwise.

      • getWinner

        public int getWinner()
        Return the player that won the game. Only applies when the game is actually over.
        Returns:
        0 if nobody has won yet, 1 if player 1 (the gold player) won, and 2 if player 2 (the red player) won.

      • getWidth

        public int getWidth()
        Gets the width of the game board in terms of grid squares.
        Returns:
        The width of the grid.

      • getHeight

        public int getHeight()
        Gets the height of the game board in terms of grid squares.
        Returns:
        The height of the grid.

      • moveUnit

        public void moveUnit(Position a,
            Position b)
        Move the piece at position a to position b.
        Parameters:
        a - The position to move from.
        b - The position to move to.

      • hasPiece

        public boolean hasPiece(Position p)
        Check if board position p currently has a piece.
        Parameters:
        p - The board position to check.
        Returns:
        True if there is the position is occupied, false otherwise.

      • isValidMoveStart

        public boolean isValidMoveStart(Position a)
        Determines whether the given position is a valid square that the player could potentially move.
        Parameters:
        a - The position to check.
        Returns:
        True if this piece would be OK to move, false otherwise.

        public void addBoardListener(BoardListener listener)
        The given listener will be called for important game updates like when a piece is moved on the board.
